revised_title: Orbital Mechanics and the Effects of Earth's Gravitational Field on Satellite Motion
tldr: This article explores the motion of satellites in the Earth's gravitational field, focusing on the effects on orbital elements and the rotation of the orbital plane. The authors develop equations for the variation of these elements and discuss the expansion of the gravitational potential. They also examine the rates of rotation of the orbital plane due to the Earth's potential and the impact of the ellipticity of the equator on this rotation.
